channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One family thought they had left Syria forever. After Assad's fall, they plan to return
item.description: Rehab Alkadi and her husband, Feras, fled Syria's war with their young son in 2013. They and other Syrian refugees in the U.S. are now hopeful for the...

item.title: Syria in maps: Who controls the country now Assad has gone?
item.description: A visual guide to the latest developments after Syrian rebels toppled President Bashar al-Assad 13 years after the start of the country's civil war.

item.title: Clues to Luigi Mangione's ideology. And, courts halt Kroger and Albertsons megamerger
item.description: Murder suspect Luigi Mangione's digital footprint could provide clues to his ideology and possible motive. And, what's next for Kroger and Albertsons ...

item.title: Judge blocks supermarket mega-merger
item.description: On Tuesday, a proposed mega-merger between two of America's largest supermarket chains was blocked in the courts. The deal would have seen Kroger acqu...

item.title: With Assad regime out, Syrians grapple with what comes next
item.description: Under Syria's president, a vast jail complex in the capital Damascus was known as a place where Syrians were disappeared without trial. Now it's crowd...

item.title: Biden approves national security memo aimed at helping Trump on China, Iran, North Korea and Russia
item.description: President Joe Biden has approved a new national security memorandum that is meant to serve as a roadmap for the incoming Trump administration as it lo...

item.title: Girl, 11, rescued in Med after three days clinging to tyre tubes
item.description: The girl from Sierra Leone said all the 44 migrants on board had died in the storms and high waves.

item.title: Luigi Mangione fights extradition to face charge of murdering CEO
item.description: The 26-year-old was arrested in Pennsylvania, and prosecutors are seeking to bring him to trial in New York.

item.title: Make these 3 big gold investing moves before 2025, experts say
item.description: If you want to invest in gold by year's end, here's how (and how not) to do it, according to experts.

item.title: Inflation remains sticky, with CPI rising 2.7% from a year ago
item.description: Inflation has cooled from its most recent peak, but progress in getting it to a 2% annual rate has been slow.

item.title: Alex Jones keeps Infowars for now after judge rejects The Onion’s winning auction bid
Man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare’s CEO shouts on way into courthouse and fights extradition
Dreaming of a Black Utopia in Trump's America
item.description: In his new book, The Black Utopians, author Aaron Robinson tells the story of how Black folks have created many different versions of utopian communit...

item.title: Syria rebels burn tomb of Bashar al-Assad's father
item.description: Armed men are seen celebrating in Hafez al-Assad's burning mausoleum in the family's hometown.

item.title: Judge rejects bankruptcy sale of Alex Jones' Infowars to The Onion
item.description: The judge criticized the auction process as flawed and said the outcome "left a lot of money on the table" for Sandy Hook families.

item.title: Coast Guard rescues missing woman shouting for help in wilderness
item.description: A 64-year-old woman was rescued from an Oregon state park where she had been stranded for almost two full days, the U.S. Coast Guard said.

item.title: 'I want justice': Victims of Syria chemical attacks speak freely for first time
item.description: The UN's chemical watchdog says dozens were killed in a chemical attack in Eastern Ghouta in 2018.

item.title: Trump's withdrawn nominees latest in a long line of Cabinet members who never were
item.description: Many presidents face failed Cabinet picks so when former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration for President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet, it wa...
